verses.verse: I am the rose <WH2261> of Sharon <WH8289>, and the lily <WH7799> of the valleys <WH6010>.
As the lily <WH7799> among tshofars <WH2336>, so is my love <WH7474> among the daughters <WH1323>.

As the apple tree <WH8598> among the trees <WH6086> of the wood <WH3293>, so is my beloved <WH1730> among the sons <WH1121>. I sat <WH3427> <WH8804> down under his shadow <WH6738> with great delight <WH2530> <WH8765>, and his fruit <WH6529> was sweet <WH4966> to my taste <WH2441>.
He brought <WH935> <WH8689> me to the banqueting <WH3196> house <WH1004>, and his banner <WH1714> over me was love <WH160>.
Stay <WH5564> <WH8761> me with flagons <WH809>, comfort <WH7502> <WH8761> me with apples <WH8598>: for I am sick <WH2470> <WH8802> of love <WH160>.
His left hand <WH8040> is under my head <WH7218>, and his right hand <WH3225> doth embrace <WH2263> <WH8762> me.

I charge <WH7650> <WH8689> you, O ye daughters <WH1323> of Yerushalayim <WH3389>, by the roes <WH6643>, and <WH176> by the hinds <WH355> of the field <WH7704>, that ye stir not up <WH5782> <WH8686>, nor awake <WH5782> <WH8787> my love <WH160>, till he please <WH2654> <WH8799>.
The voice <WH6963> of my beloved <WH1730> ! behold, he cometh <WH935> <WH8802> leaping <WH1801> <WH8764> upon the mountains <WH2022>, skipping <WH7092> <WH8764> upon the hills <WH1389>.

My beloved <WH1730> is like <WH1819> <WH8802> a roe <WH6643> or a young <WH6082> hart <WH354>: behold, he standeth <WH5975> <WH8802> behind <WH310> our wall <WH3796>, he looketh forth <WH7688> <WH8688> at the windows <WH2474>, shewing <WH6692> <WH8688> himself through the lattice <WH2762>.
My beloved <WH1730> spake <WH6030> <WH8804>, and said <WH559> <WH8804> unto me, Rise up <WH6965> <WH8798>, my love <WH7474>, my fair one <WH3303>, and come away <WH3212> <WH8798>.
For, lo, the winter <WH5638> is past <WH5674> <WH8804>, the rain <WH1653> is over <WH2498> <WH8804> and gone <WH1980> <WH8804>;

The flowers <WH5339> appear <WH7200> <WH8738> on the earth <WH776>; the time <WH6256> of the singing <WH2158> of birds is come <WH5060> <WH8689>, and the voice <WH6963> of the turtle <WH8449> is heard <WH8085> <WH8738> in our land <WH776>;

The fig tree <WH8384> putteth forth <WH2590> <WH8804> her green figs <WH6291>, and the vines <WH1612> with the tender grape <WH5563> give <WH5414> <WH8804> a good smell <WH7381>. Arise <WH6965> <WH8798>, my love <WH7474>, my fair one <WH3303>, and come away <WH3212> <WH8798>.

O my dove <WH3123>, that art in the clefts <WH2288> of the rock <WH5553>, in the secret <WH5643> places of the stairs <WH4095>, let me see <WH7200> <WH8685> thy countenance <WH4758>, let me hear <WH8085> <WH8685> thy voice <WH6963>; for sweet <WH6156> is thy voice <WH6963>, and thy countenance <WH4758> is comely <WH5000>.
Take <WH270> <WH8798> us the foxes <WH7776>, the little <WH6996> foxes <WH7776>, that spoil <WH2254> <WH8764> the vines <WH3754>: for our vines <WH3754> have tender grapes <WH5563>.
My beloved <WH1730> is mine, and I am his: he feedeth <WH7462> <WH8802> among the lilies <WH7799>.

Until the day <WH3117> break <WH6315> <WH8799>, and the shadows <WH6752> flee away <WH5127> <WH8804>, turn <WH5437> <WH8798>, my beloved <WH1730>, and be thou like <WH1819> <WH8798> a roe <WH6643> or a young <WH6082> hart <WH354> upon the mountains <WH2022> of Bether <WH1336>.
